results.title: Something to hide
results.brief_description: Harry Field’s (Peter Finch) life is turned into a nightmare when he offers a hitch-hiker (Linda Hayden) a lift. His problems are exacerbated by marital problems and alcoholism. Also starring Shelley Winters, Colin Blakely, John Stride and Linda Hayden. Also known as “Shattered” and based on the book by Nicholas Monsarrat.

results.title: Something shining
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Something shining tells the story of a young pilot, Frederick Valentich, who disappeared with his small plane over Bass Strait as he returned from a flight to King Island. His enigmatic message of sighting “something shining” just before he disappeared has led many, including his parents, to believe he was captured by a UFO.

results.title: Something Pacific
results.brief_description: Nam June Paik’s Something Pacific (1986) is made up of TVs buried in the grass outside and an interactive video wall within the building at the University of Southern California San Diego’s Media Center and is part of the Stuart Collection.

constellations_other.name: Lost and found
constellations_other.description: Blossoming from Alice Guy Blaché’s The Cabbage-Patch Fairy, this Constellation explores the impermanence and enduring nature of the moving image.

results.title: Something happened
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Brian Nicholls
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Healers quacks or mystics”.
Can supernatural forces be summoned at will to assist with human healing? In this episode Nevill Drury introduces us to spiritual healer, Rita McReady; the Assembly of God congregation in Mt. Gravatt, Qld, which conducts miracle services for sufferers each Sunday afternoon; the programs and philosophies practised at the Adventist Sanatorium Hospital in Sydney to mobilise the faith of patients to aid the healing process; the controversial Australian psychic surgeon, Chris Coles and finally the anointing and laying on of hands practised in a Sydney Anglican Church.

results.title: Something for everyone
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Bob Kingsbury and Suzanne Baker
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human Face of China”.
The production team is the basic unit of a People’s Commune in China. Following Chian Li-he and his family at home and at work, the film explains how a commune operates. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Something for everyone
results.brief_description: Looks at the problem of youth unemployment and how it affects job seekers. Uses a humorous approach to present the case of a young man who loses his job and the problems he faces when he tries to find another. Cast includes: David Bradley, Lachlin Miles, Dave Taggart, Pina Marino, Rossi Webb, Ingrid Buxton. Music: Milton Trot and Bill Menz.
